Submodules¶

imperfect_info_games.evaluate module¶

A collection of functions for evaluating strategies given a game.

imperfect_info_games.evaluate.evaluate_strategies(Game: Type[imperfect_info_games.games.game.ExtensiveFormGame], strategies: Sequence[dict], n_iters: int) → Sequence[float]¶

Evaluates a set of strategies on a game.

Args:
  • game_cls (Type[ExtensiveFormGame]): The game class to evaluate the strategies on

    (e.g., RockPaperScissorGame).

  • strategies (Sequence[dict]): A list of strategies, each is a strategy for each player

    in the game.

    (e.g.,

    player0_strat = {“P0”: [1/3, 1/3, 1/3]} # equally likely rock-paper-scissor player1_strat = {“P1”: [0.4, 0.4, 0.2]} strategies = [player0_strat, player1_strat]

    )

  • n_iters (int) : The number of iterations to run the game for.

Returns:

  • payoffs (Sequence[float]): A list of the average payoffs of each strategy.

imperfect_info_games.player module¶

A collection of player classes.

Includes:

  • Player

  • FixedPolicyPlayer

class imperfect_info_games.player.FixedPolicyPlayer(name: str, strategy: dict)¶

Bases: imperfect_info_games.player.Player

act(infostate: str) → int¶

Returns the action to take in this infostate.

Args:

  • infostate (str): The infostate to take the action in.

Returns:

  • action (int): The action to take.

class imperfect_info_games.player.Player(name='')¶

Bases: abc.ABC

An abstract player class.

  • name (str): The name of the player.

  • act(self, infostate) -> action:

    Returns the action to take in this infostate.

  • update_strategy(self, history) -> None:

    Updates the strategy of the player given the revealed history.

abstract act(infostate: str) → int¶

Returns the action to take in this infostate.

Args:

  • infostate (str): The infostate to take the action in.

Returns:

  • action (int): The action to take.

property game¶
update_strategy(history: Sequence[enum.Enum], player_id: int) → None¶

Update the strategy of the player at the end of the game.

Args:
  • history (Sequence[Enum]): The history of the game, which must

    be a terminal node.

  • player_id (int): The id of the player to update (i.e., my id).

imperfect_info_games.trainer module¶

A class to train players in an extensive form game.

class imperfect_info_games.trainer.Trainer(Game: Type[imperfect_info_games.games.game.ExtensiveFormGame], players: Sequence[imperfect_info_games.player.Player], n_iters: int = 100)¶

Bases: object

A class to train players in an extensive form game.

game (ExtensiveFormGame): The game to train players in. n_iter (int): The number of games to train for. ep_strategies (dict): The strategies of each player in each game. ep_payoffs (np.ndarray): The payoffs of each player in each game over the course of this trainer instance.

train (Sequence[Player]): Train the players for n_iter games using each player’s update_strategy function. get_avg_strategies (): Get the average strategies of each player.

property avg_payoffs: numpy.ndarray¶

Get the average payoffs of each player over the course of this trainer instance.

Returns:

np.ndarray: The average payoffs of each player.

get_avg_strategies() → dict¶

Get the average strategies of each player.

Returns:

dict: The average strategies of each player.

train(freeze_ls: Sequence[imperfect_info_games.player.Player] = []) → numpy.ndarray¶

Train the players for n_iter games using each player’s update_strategy function.

Args:

freeze_ls (Sequence[Player]): The players to freeze during training.

Returns:

np.ndarray: The average payoffs of each player during this train call.

imperfect_info_games.utils module¶

A collection of helper functions and classes.

imperfect_info_games.utils.get_action(action_probs: numpy.ndarray) → int¶

Sample an action from an action probability distribution.

Args:

action_probs (np.array): a numpy array of probabilities of length n_actions

Returns:

int: the index of the action sampled with the given probabilities

class imperfect_info_games.utils.lessVerboseEnum(value)¶

Bases: enum.Enum

A less verbose version of the Enum class.

```
class Test(lessVerboseEnum):

TEST=0

print(Test.TEST) # prints “TEST” instead of “Test.TEST”

```
